home_welcome.title: Welcome
home_welcome.message: Congratz on starting your fitness journey on AvoVibe!

home.curvyGauge: This is your daily calorie target. Click âš™ï¸ to adjust target.
home.burnedEatenNet: Keep track of your calorie deficit/surplus here.
home.burnedPencil: For best accuracy, always update this with numbers from your wearableâŒš.
home.macrosAndOtherLimits: Stay on track with your macros and goals. Tap âš™ï¸ to adjust targets.
home.mealLog: Click on the meal youâ€™ve eaten to log.
home.mealSnack: Any quick bites can be logged as Snack.
home.callItADay:
Optional but helpful:
Done logging for the day (including burn)?

Call It a Day!
home.globalFooter: Youâ€™re on Food Diary. Access your other modules here.
home.quickAddPlus:
Tap +Plus to log anything (food, weight, exercise, supplements, etc.), fast.

Get started!

mealtype.intro: View and log your meal items here.
mealtype.search:
Search food to add (i.e., egg, pho, quinoa, skim milk).

Quick tip: Perfection isnâ€™t required. Chips, for example, are nutritionally similar across most flavors and brands. Labels are estimates. Log it, relax, and keep going.
mealtype.barcode: You may scan the barcode from a food package.
mealtype.frequent: Frequent and Recent help you add your common items faster.
mealtype.custom: Item not in the database? Create your own (e.g., local bakery keto bar).
mealtype.bundles: Bundles save frequent multi-item meals so you can log them in one tap. E.g., my protein berry shake, momâ€™s special lunch box.
mealtype.quicklog:
Short on time? Use âš¡Quick Log.
Less precise, but gives you a breakâ€”perfect after a big buffet.
mealtype.foodlog:
Your logged items appear here. You can edit them anytime.

Happy logging. Progress over perfection.

exercises.intro: Track exercises here, built for fast logging.
exercises.daySummary: Exercise logs are for tracking activities, not calorie burn. Users rely on wearable data for more accurate full-day energy burn.
exercises.daySummaryGear: Tap the âš™ï¸ to set unit preferences and toggle tracking for duration, distance, reps, and more.
exercises.quickAdd:
Tap activities from the list to log.
Tip: Log as detailed or as simple as you likeâ€”some choose bench press & push-ups, others just chest.
exercises.logExerciseBtn:
Canâ€™t find your activity? Tap Log Exercise.

Happy logging!

tour.reset_toast: Tour guide reset. Go to Food Diary or Meal Log to start again.

burn_correction.title: Burn correction
burn_correction.row_subtitle: Adjust how wearable burn is applied
burn_correction.pct_helper: Applies to activity calories only (not BMR)
burn_correction.why_body: Wearables can overestimate calories for some activities. Burn correction lets you adjust activity calories so your daily burn stays realistic and consistent.
burn_correction.why_footer: Results vary by person, fitness level, and activity.

benchmarks.run_walk: â€¢ 5â€“10% for steady running and walking
benchmarks.cycling: â€¢ 10â€“20% for cycling and cardio machines
benchmarks.strength_hiit: â€¢ 20â€“30% for strength training and HIIT
benchmarks.footer: Adjust as needed as you know more about your device

burn_correction.off_note: Set % above 0 to enable burn correction. Setting it back to 0 disables correction (raw stays the same).

errors.missing_row: Could not load burned calories for this day.
errors.pct_invalid: Reduction must be a whole number (0â€“50).
errors.raw_required: Raw burn is required when burn correction is enabled.

errors.invalid_number: Please enter a valid non-negative number.
errors.tdee_below_bmr: TDEE cannot be below your system BMR.

warning.title: Unusually high burn
warning.body: 6,000+ cal is rare. Double-check your wearable or workout entry.

marketing.hero_subtitle: Log fast. No costs. No upsells. Just fitness and health.
marketing.steps_1_body: Log meals in seconds with fast search, favorites, and barcode scan.
marketing.steps_2_body: See trends, targets, and consistency at a glanceâ€”without the clutter.
marketing.steps_3_title: Eat better and hit your goals
marketing.steps_3_body: Turn what you log into simple, actionable guidance you can stick with.
marketing.feature_section_title: Built to be simple, honest, and fast.
marketing.feature_fast_body: Fewer taps to log meals. Designed for everyday use.
marketing.feature_clear_body: Macros and fibre in one place, without clutter.
marketing.feature_no_paywalls_body: Core features stay free. No subscription traps.

plan.title: Choose your plan
plan.subtitle_suffix: Free is the way to go!
plan.free_bullet_1: Log food, exercises, meds, water, and more.
plan.free_bullet_5: No upsell spam, makes you wonder what's the catch.
plan.premium_bullet_1: Why pay when Free already does the job?
plan.premium_bullet_2: AI food photo logging can be wildly off (and we offer a free alternative).
plan.premium_bullet_3: Youâ€™d miss out on adsâ€¦ if we had any.
plan.premium_bullet_4: Subscriptions add sodium to your finances.
plan.premium_bullet_5: Paying monthly wonâ€™t make broccoli taste better.
plan.premium_bullet_6: AvoVibe was designed to help you, not to milk you like other apps do.
plan.premium_next_nudge: We recommended Free. If you still want to support, tap â€œI insistâ€.
plan.donation_body:
Wow, I (the founder) truly appreciate your support.

I still canâ€™t justify locking features behind your money when thereâ€™s so much genuinely useful stuff left to build for free. Thus, there is no premium yet. If youâ€™d like to support the app anyway, sharing AvoVibe with others means a lot. You can also choose to donate to help support its growth and long-term vision.

module_preferences.title: What else do you track?
module_preferences.subtitle: Besides nutrition, pick your top 2 priorities.

goal.title: What's your goal?
goal.subtitle: This helps us set your daily targets correctly.

lose_weight.label: Weight Loss
lose_weight.description: Focus on fat loss while keeping or building some muscle.

maintain_weight.label: Maintain & Improve
maintain_weight.description: Stay at your current weight while improving your fitness.

gain_weight.label: Gain Healthy Weight
gain_weight.description: Build muscle and increase strength with a controlled surplus.

recomp.label: Body Recomposition (Advanced)
recomp.description: Lose fat and gain muscle at about the same weight.

goal.advanced_goal_hint: Double tap to show advanced goal options
goal.header: A clear goal leads to real progress.

name_age.title: A bit about you
name_age.subtitle: Your date of birth helps us calculate your calorie needs more accurately.
name_age.preferred_name_placeholder: How do you like to be called?
name_age.preferred_name_helper: Letters, numbers, spaces, and basic punctuation. One emoji max.

name_age.error_age_maximum: Please enter a valid date of birth

height.title: What's your height?
height.subtitle: Used to fine-tune your daily targets.
height.error_height_invalid: Height must be between 50 cm and 260 cm (approximately 1'8" to 8'6")

activity.title: How active are you on a typical day?
activity.subtitle: This includes your job, daily movement, and usual routine.

sedentary.label: Sedentary
sedentary.description: Mostly sitting, little walking or movement

light.label: Lightly Active
light.description: Some walking, light movement throughout the day

moderate.label: Moderately Active
moderate.description: On your feet most of the day, regular movement

high.label: Very Active
high.description: Manual work or lots of daily movement and exercise

very_high.label: Athlete Level
very_high.description: Intense daily training and physical activity

current_weight.title: What's your current weight?
current_weight.subtitle: This is your starting point today.
current_weight.body_fat_reference_hint: Double tap to view typical body fat percentage ranges
current_weight.error_weight_invalid: Weight must be between 35 kg and 250 kg (approximately 77 lb to 550 lb)
current_weight.error_body_fat_invalid: Body fat must be between 2% and 80%

body_fat_modal.title: Typical body fat % ranges {{symbol}}
body_fat_modal.subtitle: Broad population ranges by age.
body_fat_modal.no_sex: Select sex in onboarding to view ranges.
body_fat_modal.disclaimer: These ranges are broad population estimates based on fitness and health references. Individual body fat percentage varies by genetics, measurement method, and other factors. Use this only as a rough guide.

goal_weight.title: What's your goal weight?
goal_weight.error_weight_invalid: Goal weight must be between 35 kg and 250 kg (approximately 77 lb to 550 lb)
goal_weight.error_maintain_too_different: For maintaining weight, your goal weight should be very close to your current weight. Consider adjusting your goal type.
goal_weight.goal_weight_error_invalid_number: Target weight must be a valid number.
goal_weight.goal_weight_error_range_kg: Target weight must be between {{minKg}} kg and {{maxKg}} kg.
goal_weight.goal_weight_error_range_lb: Target weight must be between {{minLb}} lbs and {{maxLb}} lbs.
goal_weight.goal_weight_error_lose_not_lower: For a weight loss goal, your target weight must be lower than your current weight.
goal_weight.goal_weight_error_lose_min_delta: For a weight loss goal, choose a lower target weight.
goal_weight.goal_weight_error_lose_too_aggressive: We love that ambition! To make sure you have the energy to smash your workouts safely, we recommend a goal weight of at least half your current weight.
goal_weight.goal_weight_error_gain_not_higher: For a weight gain goal, your target weight must be above your current weight.
goal_weight.goal_weight_error_gain_min_delta: For a weight gain goal, choose a target at least {{minDelta}} lb above your current weight.
goal_weight.goal_weight_error_gain_too_aggressive: That's an amazing goal! To make sure your progress is steady and healthy, let's start with an initial milestone of {{milestone}} {{unit}} or less. We can set your next big target once you smash this one!
goal_weight.goal_weight_error_maintain_range_lb: Maintain is meant to keep weight steady. Choose a target within Â±{{delta}} lbs of your current weight.
goal_weight.goal_weight_error_maintain_range_kg: Maintain is meant to keep weight steady. Choose a target within Â±{{delta}} kg of your current weight.
goal_weight.goal_weight_error_recomp_range_lb: Recomp focuses on body composition while keeping weight stable. Choose a target within Â±{{delta}} lbs of your current weight.
goal_weight.goal_weight_error_recomp_range_kg: Recomp focuses on body composition while keeping weight stable. Choose a target within Â±{{delta}} kg of your current weight.
goal_weight.suggested_placeholder: Based on your data, we suggest: {{weight}} {{unit}}
goal_weight.nudge_hint: Drag the slider to fine-tune your goal.
goal_weight.suggestion_unavailable: We can't suggest a safe starting target for this goal based on your current stats. Please proceed with care or consider adjusting your goal.
goal_weight.subtitle: Knowing your destination helps us keep you on a safe and steady path.
goal_weight.error_lose_too_high: For a fat-loss goal, your goal weight should be lower than your current weight.
goal_weight.error_gain_too_low: For a weight-gain goal, your goal weight should be higher than your current weight.

timeline.title: When do you want to reach this goal?
timeline.subtitle: We'll use this to estimate a safe and realistic pace.
timeline.pace_adjusted: To keep things safe and sustainable, we've adjusted your pace slightly. You'll still be working steadily toward your goal.

goal_date.warn_ambitious: This is a nicely ambitious goal. Many people succeed at this pace, but taking a bit more time can make the journey smoother and increase the chances of a lasting win.
goal_date.warn_very_aggressive: This pace is very aggressive. It's not impossible, but it usually works best for highly active or very disciplined individuals. Listen closely to your body and be ready to adjust if needed.
goal_date.warn_extreme: This goal is extremely ambitious. While impressive, it may be difficult to sustain in real life. Consider allowing more time to improve your chances of success and long-term progress.
goal_date.warn_medical: This pace is extremely demanding. Goals like this are usually pursued under medical or professional supervision. While not impossible, it requires careful monitoring and may not be appropriate for most situations.
goal_date.warn_unrealistic: This pace is beyond what's realistically sustainable for most people. Goals at this level usually reflect expectations that are very difficult to achieve in real life, even with strong discipline. Consider allowing more time for a safer and more achievable path.

calorie_target.title: Daily Calorie Target
calorie_target.coming_soon: Calorie targets for your goal type are coming soon.
calorie_target.error_missing_data: Please complete previous steps to calculate your calorie target.
calorie_target.maintain_context_line: Based on your body and activity level.
calorie_target.recomp_context_line: Recomposition works best near maintenance with adequate protein.
calorie_target.gain_context_line: Weight gain requires a consistent calorie surplus.
calorie_target.maintain_leaner_subtitle: Small buffer to avoid slow gain
calorie_target.recomp_muscle_subtitle: Supports muscle gain with minimal fat gain
calorie_target.gain_warning_below_maintenance: Below maintenance â€” weight gain unlikely.
calorie_target.try_custom_pace_instead: Try using Set Custom Pace instead
calorie_target.below_700_not_supported: Below 700 cal/day is not supported. Choose another target date or weight.
calorie_target.unsafe_cannot_select: This option is unsafe and cannot be selected.
calorie_target.a11y_plan_below_safe_minimum: This option is below the safe minimum intake.
calorie_target.warning_unsafe: âš ï¸ Unsafe, consider changing your target date or weight
calorie_target.custom_warning_title: This may slow or stop weight loss
calorie_target.custom_warning_message: At this calorie level, we estimate you would not lose weight with your current activity level. You may need to be significantly more active for this to work. Your target date would no longer apply.
calorie_target.subtitle: Let's calculate your personalized calorie target based on your goals.
calorie_target.lose_context_line: Weight loss requires a consistent calorie deficit over time.
calorie_target.maintain_warning_low: Unusually low for maintenance and may lead to weight loss.
calorie_target.maintain_warning_high: May lead to gradual weight gain.
calorie_target.recomp_warning_low: Too low for effective recomposition. Muscle gain unlikely.
calorie_target.recomp_warning_high: Likely to favor weight gain over recomposition.
calorie_target.plan_ontime_desc: Designed to reach your target date.
calorie_target.plan_ontime_desc_unsafe: Cannot safely reach your target date.
calorie_target.plan_ontime_helper_unsafe: Choose a later date to enable this option.
calorie_target.plan_sustainable_desc: A steadier pace beats burning out.
calorie_target.warning_below_recommended: Below our recommended minimum, proceed with caution
calorie_target.warning_critical: Î“ÃœÃ¡âˆ©â••Ã… This would require an unsafe calorie intake. Choose another target date or weight.
calorie_target.subtitle_lose: To reach {{weight}}, choose a calorie target below maintenance:
calorie_target.subtitle_maintain: To maintain at {{weight}}, choose a calorie target near maintenance:
calorie_target.subtitle_recomp: To recomposition at {{weight}}, choose a calorie target near maintenance:
calorie_target.subtitle_gain: To gain toward {{weight}}, choose a daily calorie target above maintenance:
calorie_target.extreme_edge_case_title: âš ï¸ This goal is beyond what the app can guide safely.
calorie_target.extreme_edge_case_body: Based on your current data, standard weight-loss targets would fall below safe limits. Everyone differs (genetics, body composition, activity). Increasing activity and building consistent habits may still help over time. You can set a custom target if you know what you're doing, or go back and adjust your goal.
calorie_target.maintenance_recomp_warning_title: âš ï¸ This goal is beyond what the app can guide reliably.
calorie_target.maintenance_warning_details: Based on your current data, maintenance targets at this range are hard to estimate accurately and small fluctuations can shift outcomes. Everyone differs (genetics, body composition, activity). Increasing activity and building consistent habits may still help over time. You can set a custom target if you know what you're doing, or go back and adjust your goal.
calorie_target.recomp_warning_details: Based on your current data, recomposition targets at this range are hard to set because progress depends heavily on training quality, protein, and recovery. Everyone differs (genetics, body composition, activity). Increasing activity and building consistent habits may still help over time. You can set a custom target if you know what you're doing, or go back and adjust your goal.
calorie_target.warning_level_unsafe: This plan is unsafe and cannot be selected.
calorie_target.warning_level_red: âš ï¸ Unsafe for most people without professional supervision.
calorie_target.warning_level_neutral: Demanding â€” requires careful nutrition and monitoring.
calorie_target.a11y_decrease_calories_hint: Double tap to decrease by {{step}} cal
calorie_target.a11y_increase_calories_hint: Double tap to increase by {{step}} cal
calorie_target.a11y_adjust_activity_hint: Double tap to adjust your activity level
calorie_target.a11y_select_custom_plan: Double tap to select custom calorie target

daily_targets.title: Daily Focus Targets
daily_targets.subtitle: We've set starting nutrition reference points, they guide insights, not strict rules. Adjust them now or later.
daily_targets.reference_hint: Double tap to view {{label}} reference information
daily_targets.reset_to_baseline_hint: Double tap to reset to baseline value
daily_targets.secondary_toggle_hint: Double tap to expand or collapse secondary targets
daily_targets.constraint_settings_hint: Double tap to change constraint type
daily_targets.constraint_modal_description: Choose how this target should be enforced
daily_targets.error_missing_data: Please complete previous steps to see suggested targets.
daily_targets.based_on_calories: Based on your calorie target of {{calories}} cal/day

protein.title: Protein
protein.why_track: Protein helps preserve and build muscle and keeps you fuller for longer.
protein.what_to_aim_for: Most people do well around 0.7â€“1.0 g per lb of body weight per day.

typical_ranges.combined: Exact needs vary with size and activity.

protein.disclaimer: General guidance only, not medical advice. Needs vary with age, activity level, kidney or liver conditions, medications, and other factors.

fiber.title: Fiber
fiber.why_track: Supports digestion, fullness, and steadier energy.

typical_ranges.combined: Most adults today average only ~15â€“20 g/day.

fiber.realistic_start: ~20 g/day could be a great first goal. You can build from there.
fiber.disclaimer: General guidance only, not medical advice.

carbs.title: Carbs
carbs.why_track: Capping carbs helps limit easy calorie creep and encourages better carb choices.
carbs.what_to_aim_for: Many people do well around 30â€“55% of daily calories from carbs.

typical_ranges.combined: Intake may be much lower if you follow approaches like keto.

carbs.disclaimer: General guidance only, not medical advice. Needs vary with training, diabetes/prediabetes, medications, and other conditions.

sugar.title: Sugar
sugar.why_track: Capping sugar helps limit ultra-processed calories and supports heart and dental health.
sugar.what_to_aim_for: A practical range for many people is under ~25â€“50 g/day.
sugar.disclaimer: General guidance only, not medical advice. Individual needs vary.

sodium.title: Sodium
sodium.why_track: Capping sodium helps support healthy blood pressure and reduces hidden salt from processed foods.
sodium.what_to_aim_for: Many people do well around ~2,000â€“2,300 mg/day.
sodium.when_not_apply:
This tracking is for those who want to limit sodium.
Some very active individuals may need extra sodium to stay safe. If that applies to you, it's reasonable to opt out of this target.
sodium.disclaimer: General guidance only, not medical advice. Sodium needs vary with blood pressure, kidney or heart conditions, sweating, and medications.

terms.content:
# Terms of Service

**Version:** {{version}}

These Terms of Service ("Terms") apply to your use of the Calorie Tracker application and related services ("Service"). By creating an account, accessing, or using the Service, you agree to these Terms. If you do not agree, do not use the Service.

## 1. Eligibility and Accounts
- You must be at least 16 years old (or the minimum age of digital consent in your region) to use the Service.
- You are responsible for maintaining the security of your account credentials and for all activity under your account.

## 2. No Medical Advice; Assumption of Risk
- The Service is **informational only** and does **not** provide medical, nutritional, or emergency advice.
- The Service is **not a medical device** and is **not regulated** by health authorities.
- Calorie, nutrition, weight, and health estimates are based on assumptions and may be inaccurate.
- You must consult a licensed physician or other qualified professional for medical, nutritional, or fitness advice.
- You assume all risks from using the Service, including the risk of **serious injury or death**. If you have any medical condition or emergency, seek in-person professional care immediately.

## 3. Safe Use
- Do not use the Service while driving or in any unsafe situation.
- The Service is not for emergency or critical care use.
- You are solely responsible for any actions you take based on the information provided.

## 4. Acceptable Use
- Do not misuse the Service, interfere with others, or attempt to access it using methods other than the interface provided.
- Do not upload illegal, infringing, or harmful content.
- We may suspend or terminate access for violations of these Terms or to protect users.

## 5. Content and License
- You retain ownership of content you submit. You grant us a non-exclusive, worldwide license to host, process, and display that content solely to operate and improve the Service.
- We may generate aggregated and de-identified analytics from usage. We do **not** sell personally identifiable information.

## 6. Privacy
- Our [Privacy Policy](#) explains how we collect, use, and share information. By using the Service, you agree to the Privacy Policy.

## 7. Changes to the Service
- We may change, suspend, or discontinue the Service (or any part of it) at any time with or without notice.

## 8. Disclaimers and Limitations of Liability
- The Service is provided **"as is"** and **"as available"** without warranties of any kind.
- To the maximum extent permitted by law, we disclaim all implied warranties, including fitness for a particular purpose, accuracy, and non-infringement.
- To the maximum extent permitted by law, we are **not liable** for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages, or for loss of data, profits, revenues, business, or goodwill.
- In jurisdictions that do not allow the exclusion or limitation of liability, our liability is limited to the minimum extent permitted by law.

## 9. Indemnity
You agree to defend and indemnify us against claims, damages, losses, and expenses (including legal fees) arising from your use of the Service or violation of these Terms, to the maximum extent permitted by law.

## 10. Governing Law and Venue
These Terms are governed by the laws of the Province of Ontario, Canada, without regard to conflict of laws principles. Local mandatory consumer protections still apply. Any disputes will be resolved in the courts located in Toronto, Ontario, unless applicable law requires otherwise.

## 11. Updates to these Terms
We may update these Terms. When we do, we will update the version date above. Continued use of the Service after the effective date means you accept the updated Terms.

## 12. Contact
For questions, contact legal@calorietracker.app.

privacy.content:
# Privacy Policy

**Version:** {{version}}

This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, and share information when you use the Calorie Tracker application ("Service").

## 1. Information We Collect
- **Account and contact data:** email, name (if provided), language, and authentication data.
- **Profile and usage data:** height, weight, activity inputs, nutrition logs, goals, device and app settings.
- **Technical data:** device identifiers, OS, app version, and diagnostics.
- **Support interactions:** messages you send to us.

## 2. How We Use Information
- Provide, operate, and improve the Service.
- Personalize recommendations and estimates.
- Communicate about updates, security, and support.
- Protect against fraud, abuse, or misuse.
- Generate aggregated and **de-identified analytics** to improve the Service. We reserve the right to monetize aggregated insights that do not identify you.

## 3. Sharing
- **Service providers:** infrastructure, analytics, and support vendors under contractual confidentiality.
- **Legal and safety:** to comply with law or protect rights, safety, or property.
- **No sale of PII:** We **do not sell** personally identifiable information.

## 4. International Transfers
Data may be processed in countries other than yours. We use appropriate safeguards where required by law.

## 5. Data Retention
We keep information for as long as needed to provide the Service and comply with legal obligations. You may request deletion, subject to legal limits.

## 6. Security
We use reasonable technical and organizational measures but cannot guarantee absolute security.

## 7. Your Rights
- You may access, correct, or delete certain personal data through the app or by contacting us.
- Depending on your region (e.g., EU/UK/EEA), you may have rights to object, restrict processing, or portability. We honor valid requests subject to legal exceptions.

## 8. Children
The Service is not directed to children under the age of digital consent. If we learn we have collected data from a child without proper consent, we will delete it.

## 9. Changes to this Policy
We may update this Policy. When we do, we will update the version date above. Continued use means you accept the updated Policy.

## 10. Contact
Contact us at privacy@calorietracker.app.

health_disclaimer.content:
# Health & Medical Disclaimer

**Version:** {{version}}

- The Calorie Tracker app is **not a medical device** and is **not regulated** by any health authority.
- The app provides **informational estimates only** and may be incomplete, incorrect, or based on assumptions.
- The app **does not provide medical advice**, diagnosis, treatment, or emergency services.
- Always consult a licensed physician, dietitian, or other qualified professional before making health, nutrition, or exercise decisions.
- You use the app entirely at your own risk, including the risk of **serious injury or death**.
- If you experience an emergency or concerning symptoms, stop using the app and seek in-person professional care immediately.
- By using the app, you **accept and assume all risks** to the maximum extent permitted by law.

ai.prompt:
You are helping me create a custom food in Avovibe.app using a nutrition label image or meal photo.

OUTPUT FORMAT (STRICT):
Respond with EXACTLY ONE code block.
Inside the block, return ONLY the header fields below, one per line, in the exact order.
Do not include any text outside the single code block. (No explanations, no extra sentences, no emojis.)
If code blocks are not supported, output the same lines without any surrounding text.

HEADER FIELDS:
FOOD_NAME: <short name>
BRAND: <optional brand, or blank>
SERVING_SIZE: <number>
SERVING_UNIT: <one of g, kg, oz, lb, ml, L, fl oz, cup, pint, quart, gallon, tbsp, tsp>
TOTAL_KCAL: <number 0-5000>
Protein_G: <number with up to 1 decimal place, 0-2000>
Total_Carb_G: <number with up to 1 decimal place, 0-2000>
Total_Fat_G: <number with up to 1 decimal place, 0-2000>
FIBRE_G: <number with up to 1 decimal place, 0-2000>
Saturated_Fat_G: <number with up to 1 decimal place, 0-2000>
Trans_Fat_G: <number with up to 1 decimal place, 0-2000>
Total_Sugar_G: <number with up to 1 decimal place, 0-2000>
SODIUM_MG: <integer 0-30000>

RULES:
FOOD_NAME must be as short as possible and MUST NOT exceed 50 characters.If the image is a nutrition label and the product/food name is not visible, set FOOD_NAME: to blank (just FOOD_NAME: with nothing after it). Do not guess.
If BRAND is unknown, leave it blank.
Use numbers only (no units in values, no commas).
Decimal fields may have at most 1 digit after the decimal point.
SERVING_UNIT must match one of the allowed units exactly.
If a meal image is provided, estimate nutrition per reasonable serving.
If unsure, estimate.
DO NOT include explanations, descriptions, or reasoning.
DO NOT include any text outside the single code block.

ai.disclaimer: Powered by your own AI assistant (keeps it free).
ai.instructions: Copy the prompt, use it with your AI assistant (with your meal photo), then paste the AI reply here.
ai.step1_helper: Snap your meal, then click this button.
ai.step2_header: â‘¡ Paste prompt + ðŸ“·meal photo to AI
ai.step2_helper_prefix: Paste the copied prompt into any AI assistant like
ai.step3_helper: Paste the AI's reply below, then submit.
ai.paste_reply_placeholder: Paste the AI assistant reply hereâ€¦
ai.paste_reply_accessibility_hint: Paste the AI reply text. Then parse and fill the quick log.
ai.prompt:
You are helping me log a meal into Avovibe.app, a calorie tracker app, from a food photo.

OUTPUT FORMAT (STRICT):
Respond with EXACTLY ONE code block.
Inside the block, return ONLY the header fields below, one per line, in the exact order.
Do not include any text outside the single code block. (No explanations, no extra sentences, no emojis.)
If code blocks are not supported, output the same lines without any surrounding text.

HEADER FIELDS:
FOOD_NAME: <short name>
TOTAL_KCAL: <integer 0-5000>
Protein_G: <number with up to 1 decimal place, 0-1000>
Total_Carb_G: <number with up to 1 decimal place, 0-2000>
Total_Fat_G: <number with up to 1 decimal place, 0-1000>
FIBRE_G: <number with up to 1 decimal place, 0-1000>
Saturated_Fat_G: <number with up to 1 decimal place, 0-1000>
Trans_Fat_G: <number with up to 1 decimal place, 0-500>
Total_Sugar_G: <number with up to 1 decimal place, 0-2000>
SODIUM_MG: <integer 0-30000>
CONFIDENCE: <low|med|high>

RULES:
FOOD_NAME must be as short as possible and MUST NOT exceed 30 characters.
Use numbers only (no units in values, no commas).
Decimal fields may have at most 1 digit after the decimal point.
If unsure, estimate.
DO NOT include explanations, descriptions, or reasoning.
DO NOT include any text outside the single code block.
